head.title: Couple Are Attacked by 3 Men in Central Park

hedline.hl1: Couple Are Attacked by 3 Men in Central Park

abstract.p: New York City police report that Manhattan couple strolling through Central Park were attacked by three men who robbed man and sexually assaulted woman (S)

block.p: A Manhattan couple strolling through Central Park on Monday night were attacked by three men who robbed the man and sexually assaulted the woman, the police said yesterday.

A Manhattan couple strolling through Central Park on Monday night were attacked by three men who robbed the man and sexually assaulted the woman, the police said yesterday.

The couple had walked to the Great Lawn and were returning home shortly before 9:30 P.M. when they were approached from behind by three men near a pedestrian tunnel at 80th Street and the East Drive, said Betsy Herzog, a Police Department spokeswoman.

One assailant pointed a pellet gun at the couple, demanding the man's wallet and camera, she said. After the man, 32, handed them over he was ordered to lie face down on the grass as one of the attackers sexually assaulted his wife, 30.
The attackers, described as men 18 to 20 years old, fled toward Fifth Avenue after the couple began to scream for help, the police said. Officers found a pellet gun in the vicinity.

Both victims, whose names have not been released by the police because of the nature of the crime against the woman, refused medical attention. They said that one of the attackers wore a gray T-shirt and faded blue shorts, another wore a red tank top and dark pants and the third was in a light-colored denim shirt and shorts.

Seeking to quiet any concerns that the attack might signal a more dangerous park, Deputy Commissioner Marilyn Mode said there had been an 18 percent drop in the number of major crimes committed in Central Park so far this year compared with the same period in 1997.
